title: No, Sunder Pichai has not posted the message about changing the Indian Political system
subtitle: The message about changing the Indian Political system was not posted by Sundar Pichai. It can also be observed that his name is spelled wrong in the posted profile.
author: factly.in
vclaim:
A post is being shared widely on social media with a claim that Google CEO Sundar Pichai has posted on his Facebook account about changing the Indian Political system. Let’s try to analyze the claim made in the post. 



Fact: The message about changing the Indian Political system was not posted by Sundar Pichai. There are a lot of profiles and pages on his name. It can also be observed that his name is spelt wrong in the posted profile. Hence the claim made in the post is FALSE.

When searched on Google about Sundar Pichai making those comments, no information was found. It is also found that there is no verified account of Sundar Pichai on Facebook and there are a lot of profiles and pages on his name. Also, the same message was posted by various other users in 2016 without attributing it to him. 



It can also be observed that his name is spelt wrong in the posted profile. It should be ‘Sundar’, not ‘Sunder’. On his official Twitter and Instagram accounts, it can be seen that his name is written as ‘Sundar Pichai’.

Also, when searched if he made any similar comments from his Twitter account, no such comments were found.

To sum it up, Sunder Pichai has not posted the message about changing the Indian Political system.
